did.abstract: Joseph Vogel (1911-1995) was born in Poland and emigrated to the United States with his family in 1927. In January 1937 he volunteered to fight in Spain. The Joseph Vogel Drawings consist of 27 pen-and-ink drawings that Vogel made while in Spain during the Spanish Civil War.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Joseph Vogel (1911-1995) was born in Poland and emigrated to the United States with his family in 1927. They settled in New York and Vogel became a student at the National Academy of Design and the Art Students League. During the early 1930s Vogel was employed by the WPA and worked as assistant to Ben Shahn on a mural project. In January 1937 he volunteered to fight in Spain and was assigned to the 86th Brigade's Mixed Brigade.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 27 pen-and-ink drawings that Vogel made while in Spain, depicting soldiers in combat and at rest as well as Spanish civilians in traditional attire.
